key_responsibilities: Establishing and maintaining relationships with Connecticut, national, and D.C.-based media
Coordinating all media efforts and communication-related events
Drafting and distributing press releases and media advisories; drafting, editing, and placing op-eds
Working with digital press assistant to draft, edit and post creative content across all social media platforms
Pitching stories to reporters and producers, including national and Connecticut media, responding to press inquiries, and serving as the point-of-contact for media
Monitoring media narratives and identifying opportunities to promote the Member
Overseeing franked communications strategy, including: the drafting, design, and distribution of franked mail content
Updating the congressional website and ensuring that it features timely content
Coordinating and staffing the Congresswoman for interviews and events
Compiling and distributing press clippings
Work with legislative staff to coordinate E-newsletter
Provide weekly reports on communications activities to Member and senior staff
requirements: Superior written and oral communications skills
Strong writing, editing, and proofreading capabilities

office: Chairman of the Judiciary Subcommittee on Constitution, Civil Rights and Civil Liberties
key_responsibilities: Coordinating with committee staff
Preparing materials for hearings
Drafting legislation
Meeting with stakeholders
Writing talking points
Coordinating with Communications Director
Representing the Member at meetings and events
requirements: Strong organizational, writing, and communication skills
Thorough knowledge of House rules and legislative process
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: Managing the front office, including answering and tallying telephone calls, greeting visitors, monitoring office deliveries, distributing hard and electronic mail, and other administrative duties
Serving as the office tour coordinator
Managing constituent requests for Capitol and White House tours
Managing incoming constituent requests for flags flown over the Capitol
requirements: Eager to join a mission-oriented team that thrives in a fast-paced environment
Strong commitment to providing outstanding constituent service
Able to think on their feet and be a problem solver
Keen attention to detail and an ability to multi-task
Maintain a positive demeanor and demonstrate resilience in a busy environment

key_responsibilities: Managing the Congresswoman’s official schedule, travel plans, and related events in the district
Managing the Bothell Office Internship Program and other office operations including office equipment and supplies, required reporting, and assisting with personnel tracking
Fielding requests of the Congresswoman with staff and the public
requirements: Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment with respect to prioritization of and recommendations on the Congresswoman’s appointments
Extreme thoroughness and careful attention to detail
Experience making travel reservations and arrangements
Temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner
Availability to work long hours and at night and on weekends

key_responsibilities: Maintaining the Member's official schedule, travel plans, and associated duties
Directly assisting the Congressman and Chief of Staff in coordinating meetings involving multiple Members of Congress
Assisting in the overall operation of the Denver office
Greeting visitors
Answering the telephone and responding to constituent request for general information
Maintaining the front office and conducting various administrative duties
Assisting with casework, acting as a liaison between constituents and federal, state and local agencies
requirements: Superior communication (verbal and writing), customer service and problem-solving skills
Resilient in the face of a fast-paced and ever changing environment
Comfortable working with staff, community members and constituents
Ability to use and troubleshoot problems with photocopier, facsimile machine, telephone, and other office equipment
Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite; proficiency in word processing and mail-merge
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
Ability to drive a car – valid driver’s license

key_responsibilities: Driving the Member to events
Welcoming office visitors
Answering telephone calls
Coordinating flag and tour requests
Hiring and supervising interns
Sorting and processing constituent correspondence
Other administrative and legislative duties as assigned
requirements: Safe vehicle and a good driving record
Willing to work long hours in a fast-paced and demanding setting

key_responsibilities: Managing a very active health care portfolio, including the Member’s leadership of two high-profile caucuses
requirements: At least three years of experience developing and implementing legislative strategies in a Congressional office
Strong research, writing, and negotiation skills
Advanced degree in a health field
Ability to have fun while maintaining a busy schedule

key_responsibilities: Conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
